00080 MeshImpl::MeshImpl() 
00081     : numCoords(0),
00082       myMesh( new MeshImplData ),
00083       myTags( new MeshImplTags )
00084 {}
00085 
00086 MeshImpl::~MeshImpl()

00088   delete myMesh;

00091 
00092 MeshImpl::MeshImpl(int num_nodes, int num_elem, EntityTopology entity_topology, 
00093                    const bool *fixed, const double *coords, const int *connectivity)
00094     : numCoords(3),
00095       myMesh( new MeshImplData ),
00096       myTags( new MeshImplTags )
00097 {
00098   MsqError err;
00099   myMesh->allocate_vertices( num_nodes, err ); MSQ_ERRRTN(err);
00100   myMesh->allocate_elements( num_elem, err ); MSQ_ERRRTN(err);
00101   
00102   // Fill in the data
00103   if (fixed) {
00104     for (int i = 0; i < num_nodes; ++i) {
00105       myMesh->reset_vertex(i, Vector3D(coords + 3*i), fixed[i], err);
00106     }
00107   }
00108   else {
00109     for (int i = 0; i < num_nodes; ++i) {
00110       myMesh->reset_vertex(i, Vector3D(coords + 3*i), false, err);
00111     }
00112   }
00113 
00114   const int verts_per_elem=TopologyInfo::corners(entity_topology);
00115 
00116   std::vector<long> connect(verts_per_elem);
00117   const int* conn_iter = connectivity;
00118   for (int i = 0; i < num_elem; i++, conn_iter += verts_per_elem) {
00119     std::copy( conn_iter, conn_iter + verts_per_elem, connect.begin() );
00120     myMesh->reset_element( i, connect, entity_topology, err);
00121   }
00122 }
00123 
00124 MeshImpl::MeshImpl(int num_nodes, int num_elem, const EntityTopology *element_topologies, 
00125                    const bool *fixed, const double *coords, const int *connectivity)
00126     : numCoords(3),
00127       myMesh( new MeshImplData ),
00128       myTags( new MeshImplTags )
00129 {
00130   MsqError err;
00131   myMesh->allocate_vertices( num_nodes, err ); MSQ_ERRRTN(err);
00132   myMesh->allocate_elements( num_elem, err ); MSQ_ERRRTN(err);
00133 
00134   // Fill in the data
00135   if (fixed) {
00136     for (int i = 0; i < num_nodes; ++i) {
00137       myMesh->reset_vertex(i, Vector3D(coords + 3*i), fixed[i], err);
00138     }
00139   }
00140   else {
00141     for (int i = 0; i < num_nodes; ++i) {
00142       myMesh->reset_vertex(i, Vector3D(coords + 3*i), false, err );
00143     }
00144   }
00145 
00146   int num_indices = 0;
00147   std::vector<long> connect;
00148 
00149   // Count the number of indices
00150   const int* conn_iter = connectivity;
00151   for (int i = 0; i < num_elem; ++i) {
00152     num_indices = TopologyInfo::corners( element_topologies[i] );
00153     connect.resize( num_indices );
00154     std::copy( conn_iter, conn_iter + num_indices, connect.begin() );
00155     myMesh->reset_element( i, connect, element_topologies[i], err );
00156     conn_iter += num_indices;
00157   }
00158 }

00160 void MeshImpl::clear()
00161 {
00162   myMesh->clear();
00163   myTags->clear();
00164 }

00166 void MeshImpl::set_all_fixed_flags( bool value, MsqError& err )
00167 {
00168   for (size_t i = 0; i < myMesh->max_vertex_index(); ++i) {
00169     if (myMesh->is_vertex_valid(i)) {
00170       myMesh->fix_vertex( i, value, err ); MSQ_ERRRTN(err);
00171     }
00172   }
00173 }
00174 
00175 void MeshImpl::set_all_slaved_flags( bool value, MsqError& err )
00176 {
00177   for (size_t i = 0; i < myMesh->max_element_index(); ++i) {
00178     if (!myMesh->is_element_valid(i))
00179       continue;
00180     
00181       // Get element connectivity
00182     const std::vector<size_t>& verts = myMesh->element_connectivity( i, err ); MSQ_ERRRTN(err);
00183     
00184       // Get element properties
00185     EntityTopology type = myMesh->element_topology( i, err ); MSQ_ERRRTN(err);
00186     unsigned ncorner = TopologyInfo::corners(type);
00187     
00188     for (unsigned i = 0; i < ncorner; ++i) {
00189       myMesh->slave_vertex( verts[i], false, err ); MSQ_ERRRTN(err);
00190     }
00191     for (unsigned i = ncorner; i < verts.size(); ++i) {
00192       myMesh->slave_vertex( verts[i], false, err ); MSQ_ERRRTN(err);
00193     }
00194   }
00195 }

00198 static bool is_side_boundary( MeshImplData* myMesh,
00199                               size_t elem,
00200                               unsigned side_dim,
00201                               unsigned side_num,
00202                               MsqError& err )
00203 {
00204     // Get the vertices of the side as indices into the above 'verts' list.
00205   const EntityTopology type = myMesh->element_topology( elem, err );
00206   MSQ_ERRZERO(err);
00207   unsigned n; // number of vertices 
00208   const unsigned* conn = TopologyInfo::side_vertices( type, side_dim, side_num, n, err );
00209   MSQ_ERRZERO(err);
00210 
00211     // start with the assumption that the side is on the bounary
00212   bool boundary = true;
00213   
00214     // get vertices in element connectivity
00215   const std::vector<size_t>& verts = myMesh->element_connectivity( elem, err );
00216   MSQ_ERRZERO(err);
00217 
00218     // Choose one vertex in face, and get adjacent elements to that vertex
00219   const std::vector<size_t>& elems = myMesh->vertex_adjacencies( verts[conn[0]], err );
00220   MSQ_ERRZERO(err);
00221 
00222     // For each adjacent element
00223   for (unsigned i = 0; i < elems.size(); ++i) {
00224       // we want *other* adjacent elements
00225     if (elems[i] == elem)
00226       continue;
00227 
00228       // skip elements of smaller dimension
00229     EntityTopology type2 = myMesh->element_topology( elems[i], err );
00230     if (TopologyInfo::dimension(type2) <= side_dim)
00231       continue;
00232 
00233       // get number of 'sides' of the appropriate dimension.
00234     const std::vector<size_t>& verts2 = myMesh->element_connectivity( elems[i], err );
00235     MSQ_ERRZERO(err);
00236     int sides2 = TopologyInfo::adjacent( type2, side_dim );
00237     for (int j = 0; j < sides2; ++j) {
00238       if (TopologyInfo::compare_sides( (const size_t*)arrptr(verts),  type,  side_num, 
00239                                        (const size_t*)arrptr(verts2), type2, j, 
00240                                        side_dim, err))
00241         boundary = false;
00242       MSQ_ERRZERO(err);
00243     }
00244   }
00245   
00246   return boundary;
00247 }

00249 
00250 void MeshImpl::set_skin_flags( bool corner_fixed_flag, 
00251                                bool midnode_fixed_flag,
00252                                bool midnode_slaved_flag,
00253                                MsqError& err )
00254 {
00255     // For each element, for each side of that element, check for
00256     // an adjacent element.
00257   for (size_t i = 0; i < myMesh->max_element_index(); ++i) {
00258     if (!myMesh->is_element_valid(i))
00259       continue;
00260     
00261       // Get element connectivity
00262     const std::vector<size_t>& verts = myMesh->element_connectivity( i, err );
00263     
00264       // Get element properties
00265     EntityTopology type = myMesh->element_topology( i, err );
00266     unsigned dim = TopologyInfo::dimension( type );
00267     int sides = TopologyInfo::adjacent( type, dim-1 );
00268     bool midedge, midface, midvol;
00269     TopologyInfo::higher_order( type, verts.size(), midedge, midface, midvol, err );
00270     MSQ_ERRRTN(err);
00271     const bool midside = (dim == 2 && midedge) || (dim == 3 && midface);
00272     const bool midsubside = dim == 3 && midedge;
00273     
00274       // For each side of the element (each edge for surface elems, 
00275       // each face for volume elements)..
00276     for (int j = 0; j < sides; ++j) {
00277         // Get the vertices of the side as indices into the above 'verts' list.
00278       unsigned n; // number of vertices 
00279       const unsigned* conn = TopologyInfo::side_vertices( type, dim-1, j, n, err );
00280       MSQ_ERRRTN(err);
00281      
00282         // if side is on boundary, mark side vertices appropriately
00283       bool boundary = is_side_boundary( myMesh, i, dim-1, j, err );
00284       MSQ_ERRRTN(err);
00285       if (boundary) {
00286           // mark corner vertices as fixed
00287         for (unsigned k = 0; k < n; ++k) {
00288           myMesh->fix_vertex( verts[conn[k]], corner_fixed_flag, err );
00289           MSQ_ERRRTN(err);
00290         }
00291         
00292           // mark higher-order node in center of side as fixed
00293         if (midside) {
00294           unsigned idx = TopologyInfo::higher_order_from_side( type, verts.size(), dim-1, j, err );
00295           MSQ_ERRRTN(err);
00296           myMesh->fix_vertex( verts[idx], midnode_fixed_flag, err );
00297           MSQ_ERRRTN(err);
00298           myMesh->slave_vertex( verts[idx], midnode_slaved_flag, err );
00299           MSQ_ERRRTN(err);
00300         }
00301         
00302           // if side is a face, mark nodes on edges of face as fixed
00303         if (midsubside) {
00304           for (unsigned k = 0; k < n; ++k) {
00305             unsigned edge[2] = { conn[k], conn[(k+1)%n] };
00306             bool r;
00307             unsigned edge_num = TopologyInfo::find_edge( type, edge, r, err );
00308             MSQ_ERRRTN(err);
00309             
00310             unsigned idx = TopologyInfo::higher_order_from_side( type, verts.size(), 1, edge_num, err );
00311             MSQ_ERRRTN(err);
00312             myMesh->fix_vertex( verts[idx], midnode_fixed_flag, err );
00313             MSQ_ERRRTN(err);
00314             myMesh->slave_vertex( verts[idx], midnode_slaved_flag, err );
00315             MSQ_ERRRTN(err);
00316           }
00317         }
00318       }    
00319     } // for (j in sides)
00320   } // for (i in elems)
00321 }
00322       
00323 void MeshImpl::mark_skin_fixed( MsqError& err, bool clear_existing )
00324 {
00325   if (clear_existing) {
00326     set_all_fixed_flags( false, err ); MSQ_ERRRTN(err);
00327   }
00328   
00329   set_skin_flags( true, true, false, err ); MSQ_ERRRTN(err);
00330 }
00331       
00332 static void get_field_names( const TagDescription& tag,
00333                              std::string& field_out,
00334                              std::string& member_out,
00335                              MsqError& err )
00336 {
00337   std::string::size_type idx;
00338   
00339   if (tag.vtkType != TagDescription::FIELD)
00340   {
00341     field_out = tag.name;
00342     member_out = "";
00343   }
00344   else if (!tag.member.empty())
00345   {
00346     field_out = tag.name;
00347     member_out = tag.member;
00348   }
00349     // If field is a struct, then the Mesquite tag name is a contcatenation
00350     // of the field name and the struct member name.  Extract them.
00351   else 
00352   {
00353     idx = tag.name.find(" ");
00354     if (idx == std::string::npos)
00355     {
00356       field_out = tag.name;
00357       member_out = MESQUITE_FIELD_TAG;
00358     }
00359     else
00360     {
00361       field_out = tag.name.substr(0, idx);
00362       member_out= tag.name.substr(idx+1);
00363     }
00364   }
00365   
00366   idx = field_out.find(" ");
00367   if (idx != std::string::npos)
00368     MSQ_SETERR(err)(MsqError::FILE_FORMAT,
00369        "Cannot write tag name \"%s\" containing spaces to VTK file.",
00370        field_out.c_str());
00371   
00372   idx = member_out.find(" ");
00373   if (idx != std::string::npos)
00374     MSQ_SETERR(err)(MsqError::FILE_FORMAT,
00375        "Cannot write field member name \"%s\" containing spaces to VTK file.",
00376        member_out.c_str());
00377 }

00379 
00380 void MeshImpl::write_vtk(const char* out_filename, MsqError &err)
00381 {
00382   ofstream file(out_filename);
00383   if (!file)
00384   {
00385     MSQ_SETERR(err)( MsqError::FILE_ACCESS );
00386     return;
00387   }
00388   
00389   file.precision( 10 );
00390   
00391     // Write a header
00392   file << "# vtk DataFile Version 3.0\n";
00393   file << "Mesquite Mesh\n";
00394   file << "ASCII\n";
00395   file << "DATASET UNSTRUCTURED_GRID\n";
00396   
00397     // Write vertex coordinates
00398   file << "POINTS " << myMesh->num_vertices() << " double\n";
00399 
00400   std::vector<size_t> vertex_indices( myMesh->max_vertex_index() );
00401   size_t i, count = 0;
00402   for (i = 0; i < myMesh->max_vertex_index(); ++i)
00403   {
00404     if (myMesh->is_vertex_valid(i))
00405     {
00406       Vector3D coords = myMesh->get_vertex_coords( i, err ); MSQ_ERRRTN(err);
00407       file << coords[0] << ' ' << coords[1] << ' ' << coords[2] << '\n';
00408       vertex_indices[i] = count++;
00409     }
00410     else
00411     {
00412       vertex_indices[i] = myMesh->max_vertex_index();
00413     }
00414   }
00415   
00416     // Write out the connectivity table
00417   size_t elem_idx;
00418   size_t connectivity_size = myMesh->num_elements() + myMesh->num_vertex_uses();
00419   file << "CELLS " << myMesh->num_elements() << ' ' << connectivity_size << '\n';
00420   for (elem_idx = 0; elem_idx < myMesh->max_element_index(); ++elem_idx)
00421   {
00422     if (!myMesh->is_element_valid(elem_idx))
00423       continue;
00424     
00425     std::vector<size_t> conn = myMesh->element_connectivity( elem_idx, err ); MSQ_ERRRTN(err);
00426     EntityTopology topo = myMesh->element_topology( elem_idx, err ); MSQ_ERRRTN(err);
00427    
00428       // If necessary, convert from Exodus to VTK node-ordering.
00429     const VtkTypeInfo* info = VtkTypeInfo::find_type( topo, conn.size(), err ); MSQ_ERRRTN(err);
00430     info->mesquiteToVtkOrder( conn );
00431     
00432     file << conn.size();
00433     for (i = 0; i < conn.size(); ++i)
00434       file << ' ' << vertex_indices[(size_t)conn[i]];
00435     file << '\n';
00436   }
00437   
00438     // Write out the element types
00439   file << "CELL_TYPES " << myMesh->num_elements() << '\n';
00440   for (elem_idx = 0; elem_idx < myMesh->max_element_index(); ++elem_idx)
00441   {
00442     if (!myMesh->is_element_valid(elem_idx))
00443       continue;
00444     
00445     EntityTopology topo = myMesh->element_topology( elem_idx, err ); MSQ_ERRRTN(err);
00446     count = myMesh->element_connectivity( elem_idx, err ).size(); MSQ_ERRRTN(err);
00447     const VtkTypeInfo* info = VtkTypeInfo::find_type( topo, count, err ); MSQ_ERRRTN(err); 
00448     file << info->vtkType << '\n';
00449   }
00450   
00451     // Write out which points are fixed.
00452   file << "POINT_DATA " << myMesh->num_vertices()
00453        << "\nSCALARS fixed int\nLOOKUP_TABLE default\n";
00454   for (i = 0; i < myMesh->max_vertex_index(); ++i)
00455     if (myMesh->is_vertex_valid( i ))
00456       file <<( myMesh->vertex_is_fixed( i, err ) ? "1" : "0") << "\n";
00457 
00458   if (myMesh->have_slaved_flags()) {
00459     file << "SCALARS slaved int\nLOOKUP_TABLE default\n";
00460     for (i = 0; i < myMesh->max_vertex_index(); ++i)
00461       if (myMesh->is_vertex_valid( i ))
00462         file <<( myMesh->vertex_is_slaved( i, err ) ? "1" : "0") << "\n";
00463   }
00464 
00465     // Make pass over the list of tags to:
00466     // - Check if there are any tags on elements.
00467     // - Get the list of field names by which to group tag data.
00468     // - Assign VTK types for tags that have an unknown VTK type.
00469   MeshImplTags::TagIterator tagiter;
00470   std::multimap<std::string,size_t> fields;
00471   bool have_elem_data = false;
00472   for (tagiter = myTags->tag_begin(); tagiter != myTags->tag_end(); ++tagiter)
00473   {
00474     bool haveelem = myTags->tag_has_element_data( *tagiter, err ); MSQ_ERRRTN(err);
00475     if (haveelem) 
00476       have_elem_data = true;
00477     
00478     const TagDescription& desc = myTags->properties( *tagiter, err );
00479     std::string field, member;
00480     get_field_names( desc, field, member, err ); MSQ_ERRRTN(err);
00481     fields.insert( std::multimap<std::string,size_t>::value_type( field, *tagiter ) );
00482   }
00483   
00484     // Write vertex tag data to vtk attributes, group by field.
00485     // We already wrote the header line for the POINT_DATA block
00486     // with the fixed flag, so just write the rest of the tags now.
00487   std::multimap<std::string,size_t>::iterator f, e;
00488   f = fields.begin();
00489   while (f != fields.end())
00490   {
00491     if (!myTags->tag_has_vertex_data( f->second, err ))
00492       { ++f; continue; }
00493     
00494     int count = 0;
00495     for (e = f; e != fields.end() && e->first == f->first; ++e)
00496       if (myTags->tag_has_vertex_data( e->second, err ))
00497         ++count;
00498     if (!count)
00499       continue;
00500     
00501     if (myTags->properties(f->second, err).vtkType == TagDescription::FIELD)
00502       file << "FIELD " << f->first << " " << count << std::endl;
00503     else if (count > 1)
00504     {
00505       MSQ_SETERR(err)(MsqError::INTERNAL_ERROR,
00506         "Tag name \"%s\" conflicts with VTK field name in tag \"%s\"\n",
00507         f->first.c_str(), myTags->properties((++f)->second,err).name.c_str());
00508       return;
00509     }
00510     
00511     for (; f != e; ++f)
00512     {
00513       if (!myTags->tag_has_vertex_data(f->second, err))
00514         continue;
00515       
00516       const TagDescription& desc = myTags->properties(f->second,err); MSQ_ERRRTN(err);
00517       std::vector<char> tagdata( myMesh->num_vertices() * desc.size );
00518       std::vector<char>::iterator iter = tagdata.begin();
00519       for (i = 0; i < myMesh->max_vertex_index(); ++i)
00520       {
00521         if (myMesh->is_vertex_valid(i))
00522         {
00523           myTags->get_vertex_data( f->second, 1, &i, &*iter, err );
00524           if (err.error_code() == MsqError::TAG_NOT_FOUND) {
00525             memset( &*iter, 0, desc.size );
00526             err.clear();
00527           }
00528           else if (MSQ_CHKERR(err))
00529             return;
00530           iter += desc.size;
00531         }  
00532       }
00533       vtk_write_attrib_data( file, 
00534                              desc, 
00535                              arrptr(tagdata),
00536                              myMesh->num_vertices(),
00537                              err ); MSQ_ERRRTN(err);
00538     }
00539   }
00540   
00541     // If no element tags, then done
00542   if (!have_elem_data) 
00543   {
00544     file.close();
00545     return;
00546   }
00547   
00548     // Begin element data section
00549   file << "\nCELL_DATA " << myMesh->num_elements() << "\n";
00550     // Write element tag data to vtk attributes, group by field.
00551   f = fields.begin();
00552   while (f != fields.end())
00553   {
00554     if (!myTags->tag_has_element_data( f->second, err ))
00555       { ++f; continue; }
00556     
00557     int count = 0;
00558     for (e = f; e != fields.end() && e->first == f->first; ++e)
00559       if (myTags->tag_has_element_data( e->second, err ))
00560         ++count;
00561     if (!count)
00562       continue;
00563     
00564     if (myTags->properties( f->second, err ).vtkType == TagDescription::FIELD)
00565       file << "FIELD " << f->first << " " << count << std::endl;
00566     else if (count > 1)
00567     {
00568       MSQ_SETERR(err)(MsqError::INTERNAL_ERROR,
00569         "Tag name \"%s\" conflicts with VTK field name in tag \"%s\"\n",
00570         f->first.c_str(), myTags->properties((++f)->second,err).name.c_str());
00571       return;
00572     }
00573     
00574     for (; f != e; ++f)
00575     {
00576       if (!myTags->tag_has_element_data(f->second, err))
00577         continue;
00578       
00579       const TagDescription& desc = myTags->properties(f->second,err); MSQ_ERRRTN(err);
00580       std::vector<char> tagdata( myMesh->num_elements() * desc.size );
00581       std::vector<char>::iterator iter = tagdata.begin();
00582       for (i = 0; i < myMesh->max_element_index(); ++i)
00583       {
00584         if (myMesh->is_element_valid(i))
00585         {
00586           myTags->get_element_data( f->second, 1, &i, &*iter, err );
00587           if (err.error_code() == MsqError::TAG_NOT_FOUND) {
00588             memset( &*iter, 0, desc.size );
00589             err.clear();
00590           }
00591           else if (MSQ_CHKERR(err))
00592             return;
00593           iter += desc.size;
00594         }  
00595       }
00596       vtk_write_attrib_data( file, 
00597                              desc, 
00598                              arrptr(tagdata),
00599                              myMesh->num_elements(),
00600                              err ); MSQ_ERRRTN(err);
00601     }
00602   }
00603   
00604     // Close the file
00605   file.close();
00606 }
00607 
00608 void MeshImpl::read_exodus(const char* in_filename , MsqError &err)
00609 {
00610 #ifndef MSQ_USING_EXODUS
00611   MSQ_SETERR(err)( MsqError::NOT_IMPLEMENTED );
00612   MSQ_DBGOUT(1) << "Cannot read ExodusII file: " << in_filename << "\n";
00613   return;
00614 #else
00615   
00616   clear();
00617   
00618   int app_float_size = sizeof(double);
00619   int file_float_size = 0;
00620   float exo_version = 0;
00621   int exo_err = 0;
00622   
00623     // Open the file
00624   int file_id = ex_open(in_filename, EX_READ, &app_float_size,
00625                     &file_float_size, &exo_version);
00626 
00627     // Make sure we opened the file correctly
00628   if (file_id < 0)
00629   {
00630     MSQ_SETERR(err)( MsqError::FILE_ACCESS );
00631     return;
00632   }
00633   
00634     // make sure the file is saved as doubles
00635   if (file_float_size != sizeof(double))
00636   {
00637     MSQ_SETERR(err)("File saved with float-sized reals.  Can only read files "
00638                     "saved with doubles.", MsqError::NOT_IMPLEMENTED );
00639     return;
00640   }
00641 
00642   char title[MAX_LINE_LENGTH];
00643   int dim, vert_count, elem_count, block_count, ns_count, ss_count;
00644   
00645     // get info about the file
00646   exo_err = ex_get_init(file_id, title, &dim, &vert_count,
00647                         &elem_count, &block_count, &ns_count, &ss_count);
00648   if (exo_err < 0)
00649   {
00650     MSQ_SETERR(err)("Unable to get entity counts from file.", 
00651                     MsqError::PARSE_ERROR);
00652     return;
00653   }
00654   
00655   myMesh->allocate_vertices( vert_count, err ); MSQ_ERRRTN(err);
00656   myMesh->allocate_elements( elem_count, err ); MSQ_ERRRTN(err);
00657   
00658     // Now fill in the data
00659   
00660     // Get the vertex coordinates
00661   std::vector<double> coords(vert_count * 3);
00662   double* x_iter = arrptr(coords);
00663   double* y_iter = &coords[vert_count];
00664   double* z_iter = &coords[2*vert_count];
00665   numCoords = dim;
00666   if (dim == 2)
00667   {
00668     exo_err = ex_get_coord( file_id, x_iter, y_iter, 0 );
00669     memset( z_iter, 0, sizeof(double)*vert_count );
00670   }
00671   else
00672   {
00673     exo_err = ex_get_coord( file_id, x_iter, y_iter, z_iter );
00674   }
00675     // Make sure it worked
00676   if (exo_err < 0)
00677   {
00678     MSQ_SETERR(err)("Unable to retrieve vertex coordinates from file.",
00679                     MsqError::PARSE_ERROR);
00680     return;
00681   }
00682   
00683     // Store vertex coordinates in vertex array
00684   int i;
00685   for (i = 0; i < vert_count; ++i)
00686     myMesh->reset_vertex( i, Vector3D(*(x_iter++), *(y_iter++), *(z_iter)++), false, err );
00687   coords.clear();
00688   
00689   
00690     // Get block list
00691   std::vector<int> block_ids(block_count);
00692   exo_err = ex_get_elem_blk_ids(file_id, arrptr(block_ids));
00693   if (exo_err < 0)
00694   {
00695     MSQ_SETERR(err)("Unable to read block IDs from file.", MsqError::PARSE_ERROR);
00696     return;
00697   }
00698 
00699 
00700   std::vector<int> conn;
00701   size_t index = 0;
00702   for (i = 0; i < block_count; i++)
00703   {
00704       // Get info about this block's elements
00705     char elem_type_str[MAX_STR_LENGTH];
00706     int num_block_elems, verts_per_elem, num_atts;
00707     exo_err = ex_get_elem_block(file_id, block_ids[i], elem_type_str,
00708                                 &num_block_elems, &verts_per_elem,
00709                                 &num_atts);
00710     if (exo_err < 0)
00711     {
00712       MSQ_SETERR(err)("Unable to read parameters for block.",MsqError::PARSE_ERROR);
00713       return;
00714     }
00715     
00716       // Figure out which type of element we're working with
00717     EntityTopology elem_type;
00718     for (int j = 0; elem_type_str[j]; j++)
00719       elem_type_str[j] = toupper(elem_type_str[j]);
00720     if (!strncmp(elem_type_str, "TRI", 3))
00721     {
00722       elem_type = TRIANGLE;
00723     }
00724     else if (!strncmp(elem_type_str, "QUA", 3) ||
00725              !strncmp(elem_type_str, "SHE", 3))
00726     {
00727       elem_type = QUADRILATERAL;
00728     }
00729     else if (!strncmp(elem_type_str, "HEX", 3))
00730     {
00731       elem_type = HEXAHEDRON;
00732     }
00733     else if (!strncmp(elem_type_str, "TET", 3))
00734     {
00735       elem_type = TETRAHEDRON;
00736     }
00737     else if (!strncmp(elem_type_str, "PYRAMID", 7))
00738     {
00739       elem_type = PYRAMID;
00740     }
00741     else if (!strncmp(elem_type_str, "WEDGE", 5))
00742     {
00743       elem_type = PRISM;
00744     }
00745     else
00746     {
00747       MSQ_SETERR(err)("Unrecognized element type in block",
00748                       MsqError::UNSUPPORTED_ELEMENT);
00749       continue;
00750     }
00751     
00752     if (conn.size() < (unsigned)(num_block_elems*verts_per_elem))
00753       conn.resize( num_block_elems*verts_per_elem );
00754     exo_err = ex_get_elem_conn( file_id, block_ids[i], arrptr(conn) );
00755     if (exo_err < 0)
00756     {
00757       MSQ_SETERR(err)("Unable to read element block connectivity.",
00758                       MsqError::PARSE_ERROR);
00759       return;
00760     }
00761     
00762     std::vector<size_t> vertices(verts_per_elem);
00763     std::vector<int>::iterator conn_iter = conn.begin();
00764     for (const size_t end = index + num_block_elems; index < end; ++index)
00765     {
00766       for (std::vector<size_t>::iterator iter = vertices.begin();
00767            iter != vertices.end(); ++iter, ++conn_iter)
00768         *iter = *conn_iter - 1;
00769         
00770       myMesh->reset_element( index, vertices, elem_type, err ); MSQ_CHKERR(err);
00771     }
00772   }
00773   
00774     // Finally, mark boundary nodes
00775   int num_fixed_nodes=0;
00776   int num_dist_in_set=0;
00777   if(ns_count>0){
00778     exo_err=ex_get_node_set_param(file_id,111,&num_fixed_nodes,
00779                                   &num_dist_in_set);
00780     if(exo_err<0){
00781       MSQ_PRINT(1)("\nError opening nodeset 111, no boundary nodes marked.");
00782       num_fixed_nodes=0;
00783     }
00784   }
00785   std::vector<int> fixed_nodes(num_fixed_nodes);
00786   if (num_fixed_nodes) {
00787     exo_err = ex_get_node_set(file_id, 111, arrptr(fixed_nodes));
00788     if(exo_err<0){
00789       MSQ_SETERR(err)("Error retrieving fixed nodes.", MsqError::PARSE_ERROR);
00790     }
00791   }
00792   
00793     // See if this vertex is marked as a boundary vertex
00794   for (i=0; i < num_fixed_nodes; ++i)
00795   {
00796     myMesh->fix_vertex( fixed_nodes[i]-1, true, err ); MSQ_CHKERR(err);
00797   }
00798 
00799     // Finish up
00800   exo_err=ex_close(file_id);
00801   if(exo_err<0)
00802     MSQ_SETERR(err)("Error closing Exodus file.", MsqError::IO_ERROR);
00803 #endif
00804 }
00806 void MeshImpl::write_exodus(const char* out_filename, 
00807                                       MsqError &err)
00808 {
00809     //just return an error if we don't have access to exodus
00810 #ifndef MSQ_USING_EXODUS
00811   MSQ_SETERR(err)("Exodus not enabled in this build of Mesquite",
00812                   MsqError::NOT_IMPLEMENTED);
00813   MSQ_DBGOUT(1) << "Cannot read ExodusII file: " << out_filename << "\n";
00814   return;
00815 #else
00816   size_t i, j, k;
00817   if (!myMesh || !myMesh->num_vertices())
00818   {
00819     MSQ_SETERR(err)("No vertices in MeshImpl.  Nothing written to file.", 
00820                     MsqError::PARSE_ERROR);
00821     return;
00822   }
00823     //get some element info
00824     //We need to know how many of each element type we have.  We
00825     //are going to create an element block for each element type
00826     //that exists the mesh.  Block 1 will be tri3; block 2 will be
00827     //shell; block 3 will be tetra, and block 4 will be hex.
00828   const unsigned MAX_NODES = 27;
00829   const unsigned MIN_NODES = 2;
00830   int counts[MIXED][MAX_NODES+1];
00831   memset( counts, 0, sizeof(counts) );
00832   
00833   for (i = 0; i < myMesh->max_element_index(); ++i)
00834   {
00835     if (!myMesh->is_element_valid(i))
00836       continue;
00837     
00838     EntityTopology type = myMesh->element_topology(i, err); MSQ_ERRRTN(err);
00839     unsigned nodes = myMesh->element_connectivity(i, err).size(); MSQ_ERRRTN(err);
00840     if ((unsigned)type >= MIXED || nodes < MIN_NODES || nodes > MAX_NODES)
00841     {
00842       MSQ_SETERR(err)("Invalid element typology.", MsqError::INTERNAL_ERROR);
00843       return;
00844     }
00845     ++counts[type][nodes];
00846   }
00847   
00848     // Count number of required element blocks
00849   int block_count = 0;
00850   for (i = 0; i < MIXED; ++i)
00851     for (j = MIN_NODES; j < MAX_NODES; ++j)
00852       if (counts[i][j])
00853         ++block_count;
00854 
00855     //figure out if we have fixed nodes, if so, we need a nodeset
00856   int num_fixed_nodes=0;
00857   for (i = 0; i < myMesh->max_vertex_index(); ++i)
00858   {
00859     bool fixed = myMesh->is_vertex_valid(i) &&
00860                  myMesh->vertex_is_fixed(i, err); MSQ_ERRRTN(err);
00861     num_fixed_nodes += fixed;
00862   }
00863   
00864   
00865     //write doubles instead of floats
00866   int app_float_size = sizeof(double);
00867   int file_float_size = sizeof(double);
00868   int exo_err = 0;
00869   
00870     // Create the file.  If it exists, clobber it.  This could be dangerous.
00871   int file_id = ex_create(out_filename, EX_CLOBBER, &app_float_size,
00872                           &file_float_size);
00873 
00874     // Make sure we opened the file correctly
00875   if (file_id < 0)
00876   {
00877     MSQ_SETERR(err)(MsqError::FILE_ACCESS);
00878     return;
00879   }
00880   
00881   char title[MAX_LINE_LENGTH]="Mesquite Export";
00882   
00883   size_t vert_count = myMesh->num_vertices();
00884   size_t elem_count = myMesh->num_elements();
00885   
00886   int ns_count=0;
00887   if(num_fixed_nodes>0)
00888     ns_count=1;
00889   int ss_count=0;
00890   
00891     // put the initial info about the file
00892   exo_err = ex_put_init(file_id, title, numCoords, vert_count,
00893                         elem_count, block_count, ns_count, ss_count);
00894   if (exo_err < 0)
00895   {
00896     MSQ_SETERR(err)("Unable to initialize file data.", MsqError::IO_ERROR);
00897     return;
00898   }
00899   
00900   
00901     // Gather vertex coordinate data and write to file.
00902   std::vector<double> coords(vert_count * 3);
00903   std::vector<double>::iterator x, y, z;
00904   x = coords.begin();
00905   y = x + vert_count;
00906   z = y + vert_count;
00907   for (i = 0; i < myMesh->max_vertex_index(); ++i)
00908   {
00909     if (!myMesh->is_vertex_valid(i))
00910       continue;
00911     
00912     if (z == coords.end())
00913     {
00914       MSQ_SETERR(err)("Array overflow", MsqError::INTERNAL_ERROR);
00915       return;
00916     }
00917     
00918     Vector3D coords = myMesh->get_vertex_coords(i, err); MSQ_ERRRTN(err);
00919     *x = coords.x(); ++x;
00920     *y = coords.y(); ++y;
00921     *z = coords.z(); ++z;
00922   }
00923   if(z != coords.end())
00924   {
00925     MSQ_SETERR(err)("Counter at incorrect number.", MsqError::INTERNAL_ERROR);
00926     return;
00927   }
00928     //put the coords
00929   exo_err = ex_put_coord(file_id, arrptr(coords), &coords[vert_count], &coords[2*vert_count]);
00930   if (exo_err < 0)
00931   {
00932     MSQ_SETERR(err)("Unable to put vertex coordinates in file.",MsqError::IO_ERROR);
00933     return;
00934   } 
00935 
00936     //put the names of the coordinates
00937   char* coord_names[] = { "x", "y", "z" };
00938   exo_err = ex_put_coord_names(file_id, coord_names);
00939   
00940     // Create element-type arrays indexed by EntityTopology
00941   const char* tri_name = "TRI";
00942   const char* quad_name = "SHELL";
00943   const char* tet_name = "TETRA";
00944   const char* hex_name = "HEX";
00945   const char* wdg_name = "WEDGE";
00946   const char* pyr_name = "PYRAMID";
00947   const char* exo_names[MIXED];
00948   memset( exo_names, 0, sizeof(exo_names) );
00949   exo_names[TRIANGLE]      = tri_name;
00950   exo_names[QUADRILATERAL] = quad_name;
00951   exo_names[TETRAHEDRON]   = tet_name;
00952   exo_names[HEXAHEDRON]    = hex_name;
00953   exo_names[PRISM]         = wdg_name;
00954   exo_names[PYRAMID]       = pyr_name;
00955   unsigned min_nodes[MIXED];
00956   memset( min_nodes, 0, sizeof(min_nodes) );
00957   min_nodes[TRIANGLE]      = 3;
00958   min_nodes[QUADRILATERAL] = 4;
00959   min_nodes[TETRAHEDRON]   = 4;
00960   min_nodes[HEXAHEDRON]    = 8;
00961   min_nodes[PRISM]         = 6;
00962   min_nodes[PYRAMID]       = 5;
00963   
00964     // For each element type (topology and num nodes)
00965   int block_id = 0;
00966   char name_buf[16];
00967   int num_atts = 0;
00968   std::vector<int> conn;
00969   for (i = 0; i < MIXED; ++i)
00970   {
00971     for (j = MIN_NODES; j < MAX_NODES; ++j)
00972     {
00973         // Have any of this topo & count combination?
00974       if (!counts[i][j])
00975         continue;
00976       
00977         // Is a supported ExodusII type?
00978       if (!exo_names[i])
00979       {
00980         MSQ_SETERR(err)(MsqError::INVALID_STATE,
00981           "Element topology %d not supported by ExodusII", (int)i );
00982         return;
00983       }
00984       
00985         // Construct ExodusII element name from topo & num nodes
00986       if (j == min_nodes[i])
00987         strcpy( name_buf, exo_names[i] );
00988       else
00989         sprintf( name_buf, "%s%d", exo_names[i], (int)j );
00990       
00991         // Create element block
00992       ++block_id;
00993       exo_err = ex_put_elem_block( file_id, block_id, name_buf, 
00994                                    counts[i][j], j, num_atts );
00995       if(exo_err<0)
00996       {
00997         MSQ_SETERR(err)("Error creating the tri block.", MsqError::IO_ERROR);
00998         return;
00999       }
01000       
01001         // For each element
01002       conn.resize( counts[i][j] * j );
01003       std::vector<int>::iterator iter = conn.begin();
01004       for (k = 0; k < myMesh->max_element_index(); ++k)
01005       {
01006           // If not correct topo, skip it.
01007         if (!myMesh->is_element_valid(k) ||
01008              (unsigned)(myMesh->element_topology(k, err)) != i)
01009           continue;
01010         MSQ_ERRRTN(err);
01011         
01012           // If not correct number nodes, skip it
01013         const std::vector<size_t>& elem_conn = myMesh->element_connectivity(k, err);
01014         MSQ_ERRRTN(err);
01015         if (elem_conn.size() != j)
01016           continue;
01017         
01018           // Append element connectivity to list
01019         for (std::vector<size_t>::const_iterator citer = elem_conn.begin();
01020              citer != elem_conn.end(); ++citer, ++iter)
01021         {
01022           assert(iter != conn.end());
01023           *iter = *citer + 1;
01024         }
01025       }
01026 
01027         // Make sure everything adds up
01028       if (iter != conn.end())
01029       {
01030         MSQ_SETERR(err)( MsqError::INTERNAL_ERROR );
01031         return;
01032       }
01033 
01034         // Write element block connectivity
01035       exo_err = ex_put_elem_conn( file_id, block_id, arrptr(conn) );
01036       if (exo_err<0)
01037       {
01038         MSQ_SETERR(err)("Error writing element connectivity.", MsqError::IO_ERROR );
01039         return;
01040       }
01041     }
01042   }  
01043  
01044     // Finally, mark boundary nodes
01045   
01046   if(num_fixed_nodes>0){
01047     exo_err=ex_put_node_set_param(file_id, 111, num_fixed_nodes, 0);
01048     if(exo_err<0) {
01049       MSQ_SETERR(err)("Error while initializing node set.", MsqError::IO_ERROR);
01050       return;
01051     }
01052     
01053     int node_id = 0;
01054     std::vector<int> fixed_nodes( num_fixed_nodes );
01055     std::vector<int>::iterator iter = fixed_nodes.begin();
01056     for (i = 0; i < myMesh->max_vertex_index(); ++i)
01057     {
01058       if (!myMesh->is_vertex_valid(i))
01059         continue;
01060       ++node_id;
01061       
01062       if (myMesh->vertex_is_fixed( i, err ))
01063       {
01064         if (iter == fixed_nodes.end())
01065         {
01066           MSQ_SETERR(err)(MsqError::INTERNAL_ERROR);
01067           return;
01068         }
01069         *iter = node_id;
01070         ++iter;
01071       }
01072     }
01073     
01074     if (iter != fixed_nodes.end())
01075     {
01076       MSQ_SETERR(err)(MsqError::INTERNAL_ERROR);
01077       return;
01078     }
01079 
01080     exo_err=ex_put_node_set(file_id, 111, arrptr(fixed_nodes));
01081     if(exo_err<0) {
01082       MSQ_SETERR(err)("Error while writing node set.", MsqError::IO_ERROR);
01083       return;
01084     }
01085   }
01086   exo_err=ex_close(file_id);
01087   if(exo_err<0)
01088     MSQ_SETERR(err)("Error closing Exodus file.", MsqError::IO_ERROR);
01089   
01090 #endif
01091 }
01092 
01093 // Returns whether this mesh lies in a 2D or 3D coordinate system.
01094 
01095 int MeshImpl::get_geometric_dimension(MsqError &/*err*/)
01096 {
01097   return numCoords;
01098 }
01099 
01100 
01101 void MeshImpl::get_all_elements( std::vector<ElementHandle>& elems,
01102                                  MsqError& err )
01103 {
01104   assert( sizeof(ElementHandle) == sizeof(size_t) );
01105   std::vector<size_t> temp;
01106   myMesh->all_elements( temp, err ); MSQ_ERRRTN(err);
01107   elems.resize( temp.size() );
01108   if (!elems.empty())
01109     memcpy( arrptr(elems), arrptr(temp), sizeof(size_t)*temp.size() );
01110 }
01111 
01112 void MeshImpl::get_all_vertices( std::vector<VertexHandle>& verts,
01113                                  MsqError& err )
01114 {
01115   assert( sizeof(VertexHandle) == sizeof(size_t) );
01116   std::vector<size_t> temp;
01117   myMesh->all_vertices( temp, err ); MSQ_ERRRTN(err);
01118   verts.resize( temp.size() );
01119   if (!verts.empty())
01120     memcpy( arrptr(verts), arrptr(temp), sizeof(size_t)*temp.size() );
01121 }
01122 
01123 // Returns a pointer to an iterator that iterates over the
01124 // set of all vertices in this mesh.  The calling code should
01125 // delete the returned iterator when it is finished with it.
01126 // If vertices are added or removed from the Mesh after obtaining
01127 // an iterator, the behavior of that iterator is undefined.
01128 VertexIterator* MeshImpl::vertex_iterator(MsqError &/*err*/)
01129 {
01130   return new MeshImplVertIter( myMesh );
01131 }
01132     
01133 // Returns a pointer to an iterator that iterates over the
01134 // set of all top-level elements in this mesh.  The calling code should
01135 // delete the returned iterator when it is finished with it.
01136 // If elements are added or removed from the Mesh after obtaining
01137 // an iterator, the behavior of that iterator is undefined.
01138 ElementIterator* MeshImpl::element_iterator(MsqError &/*err*/)
01139 {
01140   return new MeshImplElemIter( myMesh );
01141 }
01142 
01143 //************ Vertex Properties ********************
01144 // Returns true or false, indicating whether the vertex
01145 // is allowed to be repositioned.  True indicates that the vertex
01146 // is fixed and cannot be moved.  Note that this is a read-only
01147 // property; this flag can't be modified by users of the
01148 // Mesh interface.
01149 void MeshImpl::vertices_get_fixed_flag(
01150  const VertexHandle vert_array[], 
01151  std::vector<bool>& on_bnd,
01152  size_t num_vtx, MsqError& err)
01153 {
01154   on_bnd.resize(num_vtx);
01155   for (size_t i=0; i<num_vtx; ++i)
01156   {
01157     on_bnd[i] = myMesh->vertex_is_fixed( (size_t)vert_array[i], err ); 
01158     MSQ_ERRRTN(err);
01159   }
01160 }
01161 
01162 void MeshImpl::vertices_set_fixed_flag(
01163  const VertexHandle vert_array[], 
01164  const std::vector<bool>& on_bnd,
01165  size_t num_vtx, MsqError& err)
01166 {
01167   assert(on_bnd.size() >= num_vtx);
01168   for (size_t i=0; i<num_vtx; ++i)
01169   {
01170     myMesh->fix_vertex( (size_t)vert_array[i], on_bnd[i],  err ); 
01171     MSQ_ERRRTN(err);
01172   }
01173 }
01174 void MeshImpl::vertices_get_slaved_flag(
01175  const VertexHandle vert_array[], 
01176  std::vector<bool>& flags,
01177  size_t num_vtx, MsqError& err)
01178 {
01179   flags.resize(num_vtx);
01180   for (size_t i=0; i<num_vtx; ++i)
01181   {
01182     flags[i] = myMesh->vertex_is_slaved( (size_t)vert_array[i], err ); 
01183     MSQ_ERRRTN(err);
01184   }
01185 }
01186

01188 // Get/set location of a vertex
01189 void MeshImpl::vertices_get_coordinates(
01190  const Mesh::VertexHandle vert_array[],
01191  MsqVertex* coordinates,
01192   size_t num_vtx,
01193  MsqError& err)
01194 {
01195   for (size_t i=0; i<num_vtx; ++i) {
01196     coordinates[i] = myMesh->get_vertex_coords( (size_t)vert_array[i], err );
01197     MSQ_ERRRTN(err);
01198   }
01199 }

01202 
01203 void MeshImpl::vertex_set_coordinates(
01204   VertexHandle vertex,
01205   const Vector3D &coordinates,
01206   MsqError& err)
01207 {
01208   myMesh->set_vertex_coords( (size_t)vertex, coordinates, err ); MSQ_CHKERR(err);
01209 }
01210 
01211 // Each vertex has a byte-sized flag that can be used to store
01212 // flags.  This byte's value is neither set nor used by the mesh
01213 // implementation.  It is intended to be used by Mesquite algorithms.
01214 // Until a vertex's byte has been explicitly set, its value is 0.
01215 void MeshImpl::vertex_set_byte ( VertexHandle vertex,
01216                                            unsigned char byte,
01217                                            MsqError& err)
01218 {
01219   vertices_set_byte( &vertex, &byte, 1, err ); MSQ_CHKERR(err);
01220 }
01221 
01222 void MeshImpl::vertices_get_byte ( const VertexHandle *vert_array,
01223                                    unsigned char *byte_array,
01224                                    size_t array_size,
01225                                    MsqError& err)
01226 {
01227   for (size_t i = 0; i < array_size; i++)
01228   {
01229     byte_array[i] = myMesh->get_vertex_byte( (size_t)vert_array[i], err ); 
01230     MSQ_ERRRTN(err);
01231   }
01232 }
01233 
01234 // Retrieve the byte value for the specified vertex or vertices.
01235 // The byte value is 0 if it has not yet been set via one of the
01236 // *_set_byte() functions.
01237 void MeshImpl::vertex_get_byte( const VertexHandle vertex,
01238                                 unsigned char *byte,
01239                                 MsqError &err )
01240 {
01241   vertices_get_byte( &vertex, byte, 1, err ); MSQ_CHKERR(err);
01242 }
01243 
01244 void MeshImpl::vertices_set_byte( const VertexHandle *vertex,
01245                                   const unsigned char *byte_array,
01246                                   size_t array_size,
01247                                   MsqError& err)
01248 {
01249   for (size_t i = 0; i < array_size; i++)
01250   {
01251     myMesh->set_vertex_byte( (size_t)vertex[i], byte_array[i], err );
01252     MSQ_ERRRTN(err);
01253   }

01255 
01256 template <typename T> struct cast_handle : public std::unary_function<size_t, T>
01257 { 
01258 T operator()( size_t idx ) const 
01259 { 
01260   return reinterpret_cast<T>(idx); 
01261 } 
01262 
01263 };
01264 
01265 void MeshImpl::vertices_get_attached_elements( const VertexHandle* vertices,
01266                                                size_t num_vertices,
01267                                                std::vector<ElementHandle>& elements,
01268                                                std::vector<size_t>& offsets,
01269                                                MsqError& err )
01270 {
01271   elements.clear();
01272   offsets.clear();
01273   size_t prev_offset = 0;
01274   offsets.reserve( num_vertices + 1 );
01275   offsets.push_back( prev_offset );
01276   const VertexHandle *const vtx_end = vertices + num_vertices;
01277   for (; vertices < vtx_end; ++vertices) {
01278     const std::vector<size_t>& adj 
01279       = myMesh->vertex_adjacencies( (size_t)*vertices, err );
01280     MSQ_ERRRTN(err);
01281     
01282     prev_offset = prev_offset + adj.size();
01283     offsets.push_back( prev_offset );
01284     
01285     std::transform( adj.begin(), adj.end(), std::back_inserter( elements ), cast_handle<ElementHandle>() );
01286   }
01287 }
01288 
01289 
01290 
01291 void MeshImpl::elements_get_attached_vertices( const ElementHandle *elements,
01292                                                size_t num_elems,
01293                                                std::vector<VertexHandle>& vertices,
01294                                                std::vector<size_t>& offsets,
01295                                                MsqError &err) 
01296 {
01297   vertices.clear();
01298   offsets.clear();
01299   size_t prev_offset = 0;
01300   offsets.reserve( num_elems + 1 );
01301   offsets.push_back( prev_offset );
01302   const ElementHandle *const elem_end = elements + num_elems;
01303   for (; elements < elem_end; ++elements) {
01304     const std::vector<size_t>& conn 
01305       = myMesh->element_connectivity( (size_t)*elements, err );
01306     MSQ_ERRRTN(err);
01307     
01308     prev_offset = prev_offset + conn.size();
01309     offsets.push_back( prev_offset );
01310     
01311     std::transform( conn.begin(), conn.end(), std::back_inserter( vertices ), cast_handle<VertexHandle>() );
01312   }
01313 }
01314 
01315 // Returns the topologies of the given entities.  The "entity_topologies"
01316 // array must be at least "num_elements" in size.
01317 void MeshImpl::elements_get_topologies( const ElementHandle *element_handle_array,
01318                                         EntityTopology *element_topologies,
01319                                         size_t num_elements,
01320                                         MsqError& err)
01321 {
01322   for (size_t i = 0; i < num_elements; i++)
01323   {
01324     element_topologies[i] = myMesh->
01325       element_topology( (size_t)element_handle_array[i], err );
01326     MSQ_CHKERR(err);
01327   }
01328 }

01334 //**************** Memory Management ****************
01335 // Tells the mesh that the client is finished with a given
01336 // entity handle.  
01337 void MeshImpl::release_entity_handles(
01338   const EntityHandle* /*handle_array*/,
01339   size_t /*num_handles*/,
01340   MsqError &/*err*/)
01341 {
01342     // Do nothing
01343 }

01345 // Instead of deleting a Mesh when you think you are done,
01346 // call release().  In simple cases, the implementation could
01347 // just call the destructor.  More sophisticated implementations
01348 // may want to keep the Mesh object to live longer than Mesquite
01349 // is using it.
01350 void MeshImpl::release()
01351 {
01352   //delete this;
01353 }
